headless¶

Functions and classes useful for operating a headless device e.g. Raspberry Pi or Intelligent Edge Gateway

Returns True if the object is a Logger

Determines if a given (named) Handler is assigned to a Logger.

Parameters:

  • handler (logging.Handler) – a handler object
Returns:

result

headless.get_caller_name(depth=2, mod=True, cls=False, mth=False)¶

Gets the name of the calling module/class/method with format [module][.class][.method]

Parameters:
  • depth (int) – the depth of the caller if passing through multiple methods (optional)
  • mod (bool) – include module in name (optional)
  • cls (bool) – include class in name (optional)
  • mth (bool) – include method in name (optional)
Returns:

caller name as [module][.class][.method]
Return type:

str
headless.get_wrapping_logger(name=None, filename=None, file_size=5, debug=False)¶

Initializes logging to console, and optionally a wrapping CSV formatted file of defined size. Default logging level is INFO. Timestamps are GMT/UTC/Zulu.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of the logger (optional, if None will use name of calling module)
  • filename (str) – the name of the file if writing to a file (optional, no file created if not specified)
  • file_size (int) – the max size of the file in megabytes, before wrapping occurs (optional)
  • debug (bool) – enable DEBUG logging (default INFO)
Returns:

a configured Logger
Return type:

logging.Logger
class headless.RepeatingTimer(seconds, callback, name=None, sleep_chunk=0.25, auto_start=True, defer=True, tick_log=False, **kwargs)¶

A Thread class that repeats function calls like a Timer but can be stopped, restarted and change interval. Thread can be automatically started on initialization, but timer must be started explicitly with start_timer(). Uses logging which is set up based on the name of the calling module.

Parameters:
  • callback (function) – the callback to execute each timer expiry
  • seconds (int) – interval for timer repeat
  • name (str) – used to identify the thread
  • sleep_chunk (float) – tick cycle in seconds between state checks
  • auto_start (bool) – automatically start the thread on initialization
  • defer (bool) – wait until the first timer expiry before calling back
  • tick_log (bool) – optional verbose debug logging of tick count (watch countdown)
  • kwargs (dict) – optional keyword/value arguments to pass into the callback
run()¶

Counts down the interval, checking every sleep_chunk the desired state.

start_timer()¶

Initially start the repeating timer, or continue from where stopped.

stop_timer()¶

Stop the repeating timer.

restart_timer()¶

Restart the repeating timer (e.g. after an interval change).

change_interval(seconds)¶

Change the timer interval and restart it.

Parameters:seconds (int) – new timer value
terminate()¶

Terminate the timer. (Cannot be restarted)
